intro: Zoellnerallium serenense, commonly known as the Serenense Starflower, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and flowering structures. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped flowers, which are typically pale blue or white, and its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Zoellnerallium serenense is considered a vulnerable species.
